Description: Corinthian black-figured pottery globular aryballos; exterior: tongue pattern on top of mouth; single row of dots around edge of rim; tongue pattern on shoulder; below, incised floral pattern with added red; incised splinter rosettes as filling ornament.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 121, pl. XXXVII, no. 343)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 229-30, no. 153)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.287) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4745 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
